text: traffic in Nairobi is a nightmare just
about on the same hectic level as Manila
and Dhaka we're stuck in terrible
traffic but there's one thing that makes
it a little more enjoyable and if my
local friends have told me it represents
Nairobi culture in a nutshell you
haven't really been to Kenya until you
ride a motor to Amma tattoo is a shared
minibus but more like a disco party on
wheels that zip through Kenya's capital
in style
each matatu is louder than the neck with
pimped out sound system complete with
graffiti exteriors custom designs -
Ninja Turtles flashy lights and onboard
entertainment to pull in the crowd I'm
talking LED lights flat-screen TVs Wi-Fi
and more it's a dog-eat-dog business
where drivers try to out the other
drivers to make more money but if
there's one thing that all matatu share
in common they are always packed tight
and the drivers are reckless oh I got an
accident yes hatachi guys
[Applause]
10 was born ready
Mad Max getting on board is a scene in
itself and once you're moving it feels
like a roller coaster and it's
definitely not safe nor for the
claustrophobic my tattoos are cheap
convenient and a tad chaotic but they
are the national pride and soul and
number one choice of public
transportation in Nairobi if you come
here and don't rat him a tattoo you're
simply missing out I'm drew pinsky and
if you like my videos please click
Subscribe and join me as I plan to visit
every country in the world
